meanings.definition: The quality of being unpalatable or unpleasant to taste.
meanings.sent1: The unpalatability of the medicine made it difficult to swallow.
meanings.sent2: The unpalatability of the food was evident from the frowns on everyone's faces.
meanings.sent3: The unpalatability of the broccoli was so extreme that even the dog refused to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The unpalatability of the situation left a bitter taste in her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The unpalatability of the dish lingered in his memory long after the meal was over.

meanings.definition: The state of being unappetizing or disagreeable.
meanings.sent1: The unpalatability of the movie made it hard to sit through.
meanings.sent2: The unpalatability of the drink was evident from the empty glasses left untouched.
meanings.sent3: The unpalatability of the joke left everyone in awkward silence.
meanings.sent4: The unpalatability of the news hit her like a ton of bricks.
meanings.sent5: The unpalatability of the weather made outdoor activities unbearable.
